title: Spec Evolution Viz: Next UX/Feature Pass
description: Follow-up work to make the spec-evolution visualization more powerful, intuitive, and shareable (desktop + mobile), while keeping everything static-site deployable (Cloudflare Pages) and offline-friendly.

title: Viz: Compare Two Arbitrary Commits (A/B)
description: Add a compare mode where users pick two commits (A and B) and see a rendered diff between reconstructed spec snapshots (Diff2Html), plus metrics (lines/tokens/lev). Should support keyboard + mobile-friendly selection.

title: Viz: Heading Mini-Map + Changed-Section Highlighting
description: Add a left-side (desktop) / slide-over (mobile) heading mini-map generated from the rendered markdown, with per-commit indicators for which headings changed. Clicking a heading scrolls the doc pane; diff view can auto-scroll to first change under that heading.

title: Viz: Shareable Permalinks (URL State) + Copy Link
description: Encode visualization state in the URL (commit idx, tab, resolution, metric, bucket filters). Add a Copy Link button. Deep links should load without needing any server logic.

title: Viz: Story Mode (Curated Milestones + Autoplay)
description: Add an optional narrative layer: curated milestones (hand-picked commits) with short annotations and an autoplay scrubber. Desktop: right-side timeline card; Mobile: full-screen swipeable cards.

title: Viz: Performance Pass (Worker Metrics + Caching)
description: Move heavy work (patch application for far jumps, Levenshtein precompute) into a WebWorker; cache reconstructed snapshots/metrics in-memory + localStorage keyed by dataset hash. Keep initial load fast.

title: Viz: Dataset Tooling (Regen + Validate)
description: Add a small, safe regeneration + validation tool for spec_evolution_data_v1.json.gz (append new commits, assert patches apply cleanly, assert commit counts match git). Prefer a one-shot CLI (Rust or Python) with zero repo-wide rewrites.

title: Spec: TxnSlot claiming_timestamp stale during CLEANING takeover
description: In ยง5.6.2 cleanup_orphaned_slots, a cleaner CASes txn_id -> TXN_ID_CLEANING and then stores claiming_timestamp=now. There is a window where another cleaner can observe txn_id==TXN_ID_CLEANING while claiming_timestamp still contains a stale value from the previous owner (Phase 1 claim time), causing spurious 'stuck CLEANING' takeover. Proposed fix: after Phase 3 publish CAS succeeds (TXN_ID_CLAIMING -> real_txn_id), clear claiming_timestamp to 0 (Release). This makes a future CLEANING transition start from 0, so concurrent cleaners seed a fresh timestamp via CAS(0->now) rather than treating stale timestamps as stuck.
close_reason: Completed in spec: TxnSlot Phase 3 publish clears claiming_timestamp to 0 (Release); cleanup_orphaned_slots seeds claiming_timestamp via CAS(0->now) for CLAIMING/CLEANING so stale timestamps cannot trigger spurious stuck-CLEANING takeover.
